name: PubSub
description:
Google Cloud Pub/Sub is in Alpha status. As a result, it might be changed in backward-incompatible ways and is not recommended for production use. It is not subject to any SLA or deprecation policy.

The gcloud.pubsub method will return a pubsub object, allowing you to create topics, publish messages, subscribe to topics, and more.

To learn more about Pub/Sub, see the Google Cloud Pub/Sub overview.

methods.name: PubSub
methods.description:
Google Cloud Pub/Sub is a reliable, many-to-many, asynchronous messaging service from Google Cloud Platform.

Note: Google Cloud Pub/Sub API is available as a Limited Preview and the client library we provide is currently experimental. The API and/or the client might be changed in backward-incompatible ways. This API is not subject to any SLA or deprecation policy. Request to be whitelisted to use it by filling the Limited Preview application form.

methods.name: getTopics
methods.description: Get a list of the topics registered to your project. You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • A query object representing the next page of topics.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response from the service.

methods.name: createTopic
methods.description: Create a topic with the given name.

examples.caption: Note: For cases like the one above, it is simpler to use pubsub#topic, which will create the topic for you at the time you publish a message.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response from the service.

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Create a subscription to a topic. You may optionally provide an object to customize the subscription.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error occurred or a pubsub/subscription object.

examples.caption: Subscribe to a topic. (Also see pubsub/topic#subscribe).
Customize the subscription.
Create a subscription to a topic from another project.

params.description: topic - The Topic to create a subscription to.

params.name: options.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description: • The maximum time after receiving a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled. (default: false)

params.name: options.interval
params.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages. (default: 10)

params.name: options.reuseExisting
params.description: • If the subscription already exists, reuse it. The options of the existing subscription are not changed. If false, attempting to create a subscription that already exists will fail. (default: false)

exceptions.description: If a Topic instance or topic name is not provided.

methods.name: subscription
methods.description: Create a Subscription object in reference to an existing subscription. This command by itself will not run any API requests. You will receive a pubsub/subscription object, which will allow you to interact with your subscription.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled.

params.name: options.interval
params.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages.

methods.name: topic
methods.description: Create a Topic object to reference an existing topic.

examples.caption: By default, it isn't required to specify a topic that already exists. The first time you publish a message, the topic will be created for you. This will only cost one additional API request at the time of publishing. If the topic doesn't need to be created, there is no performance penalty.
If you prefer an error when trying to publish to a topic that doesn't exist, set autoCreate to false.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create topic if it doesn't exist. Note that messages published to a topic with no subscribers will not be delivered. Default: true.

methods.name: getSubscriptions
methods.description:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to all of your project's topics. You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error occurred or an array of pubsub/subscription objects.

To get subscriptions for a topic, see pubsub/topic.

params.name: options.topic
params.description: • The name of the topic to list subscriptions from.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • A query object representing the next page of topics.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • The full API response from the service.
